attributes.action: To exempt redundancy payments from the new £150k tax band if paid into pensions.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the recent budget, the Government outlined some changes with regards to people who could "earn" over £150,000 a year.
 Anyone putting redundancy cash into their pensions would also be hit.
You may have thought that this would only affect the rich and famous but you are wrong.

[ Remember, when they draw their pensions they will be taxed].

REDUNDANCY is not EARNINGS it is compensation for the loss of your job. 


Taxing people twice is fundamentally wrong.  Taxing employees on the company contribution at 30% and then taxing the pension in payment at 40% or 50% (depending on income levels) has to be fundamentally wrong. 
The whole ethos of pensions is that it is deferred pay and that it will be taxed either on the way in or on the way our - but not both. 
 The problem again is that pensions is being seen as an easy target and hitting high paid as politically acceptable. But it is the very thin edge of the wedge - and, as I say, this should be a concern to all.
